intro: Cryptostylis acutata, commonly known as the acute-leafed spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom during the autumn season. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its leaves are linear and pointed, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cryptostylis acutata is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its specialized pollination mechanisms involving certain insect species.
